column4: how can I export evolutions address book into a format that mac's address book can understand?
yes it does, but the vcard export from evolution seems to be strange because after the import all characters are chinese signs ...
ubuntu uses UTF-8 by default, maybe Mac OS doesn't use that?
if i open the export on ubuntu in vim I have a lot of ^M (at the end of every line) is that normal?
i don't know, does the rest of the characters look OK?
yes the rest is ok, but the field names are strange they have x-evolution in their names
all of the fields have x-evolujtion in them?
no, but the mobile phone for example
i suspect a character encoding problem
and I don't think that mac can read/understand this
that should not be any problem, the x-evolution is just redundant data. you have to transfer the vcf file in ascii mode
I send the vcf file per mail to the mac, how can I control if it's ascii mode?
i don't know. maybe you could zip it first? or another compression and choose text mode explicitly
i don't see an option to select text mode with gnome archiver ...
another option would be to convert the file in Mac OS X from UTF-8 to the native macosx format (iso latin-1?)
